title: Dominican Republic: Citi Foundation Supports Launch of Culinary Development Program
summary: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic - The Citi Foundation continued its support of the Mir Foundation by providing scholarships, facility upgrades and supplies to assist students in the Foundation's programs.
tag-1: Dominican Republic: Citi Foundation Supports Launch of Culinary Development Program
tag-2: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic – The Citi Foundation continued its support of the Mir Foundation by providing scholarships, facility upgrades and supplies to assist students in the Foundation's programs.
tag-3: Maximo Vidal, Citi Country Officer for the Dominican Republic, gathered with students and staff from the Foundation to inaugurate a new kitchen in Mir Esperanza Polytechnic's dining area. He also delivered uniforms, books and all the necessary equipment for the new kitchen.
tag-4: During the ribbon cutting, the school principal, Ramon Nieves delivered opening remarks, and Father Brian King gave an opening blessing. Vidal and Lian Franjul, founder and President of Mir Esperanza, cut the ribbon for the new kitchen.
tag-5: The Mir Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to assisting children and their families break free from poverty by identifying and addressing their needs through collaborative and educational service programs. Chaired by Lian Fanjul de Azqueta, the Foundation has operated since 1990.
tag-6: "We are proud to support the ongoing initiatives of the Mir Foundation, which confirms our commitment to the communities where we live and work. Accordingly, Citi has decided to grant scholarships to all young people taking part in this culinary program," said Vidal, reaffirming Citi's vision and commitment to the communities it serves.
tag-7: Citi's decision to grant scholarships was great news for the students. "On behalf of my classmates and as class president, I want to thank Citi. We will make good use of the opportunity Citi is giving us, because these scholarships benefit not just for us but also our parents, who inspire us to stand up to our commitment to you," said Edally Pereyra, Esperanza Polytechnic student.
tag-8: The ribbon cutting took place at Mir Foundation headquarters, located in La Romana city, and was attended by leading members of the executive committee, teachers and volunteers from the Mir Foundation.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-11: Citi Foundation Citi Foundation is committed to the communities we work with economic growth of individuals and families, particularly those most in need, to raise their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
tag-12: Mir Foundation Mir Foundation was founded by Alfonso Fanjul and Lian Fanjul de Azqueta to provide educational, social and health services to support indigent children and their families in La Romana province in the Southeast region of Dominican Republic. The organization is aimed to: assisting children and its families to help them get out of poverty by identifying and addressing their needs with collaborative programs and targeted services, support in the building of the operational infrastructure and the assessment of the projects' results; as well as collaborating with churches, universities, governmental and non-governmental societies to develop activities which enhance and promote the reception of private donations. Mir Foundation supports big projects such as the MIR Esperanza Polytechnic, MIR Elementary School, and MIR Foundation Polytechnic.
